title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: process exploratory analysis cross-sectional longitudinal configurations. First, execute either Single Site, Exploratory analyses, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column.
code: library(expectedvariablespresent)  my_table <- evp_process(cohort = my_cohort,                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                         time = T / F,                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n)

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: anomaly detection analysis, start executing steps exploratory analysis. , execute relevant anomaly detection algorithm resulting table. See different processes cross-sectional longitudinal analysis.

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: cross-sectional analysis, compute_dist_anomalies detect_outliers functions, available squba.gen package, executed results. Copy code , inputting table generated. like apply anomaly detection patient-level counts, analysis_level set prop_pt_variable. prefer use row counts, set prop_row_variable. p_value can selected user.
code: # First execute the compute_dist_anomalies function df_start <- compute_dist_anomalies(df_tbl = my_table,                                    grp_vars = c('variable'),                                    var_col = analysis_level,                                    denom_cols = c('variable', 'total_pt_ct', 'total_row_ct'))  # Then, use that output as input for the detect_outliers function df_final <- detect_outliers(df_tbl = df_start,                             tail_input = 'both',                             p_input = p_value,                             column_analysis = analysis_level,                             column_variable = 'variable')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: longitudinal analysis, ms_anom_euclidean function, available squba.gen package, executed results. Copy code , inputting data generated. like apply anomaly detection patient-level counts, analysis_level set prop_pt_variable. prefer use row counts, set prop_row_variable.
code: df <- ms_anom_euclidean(fot_input_tbl = my_table,                         grp_vars = c('site', 'variable'),                         var_col = analysis_level)

what: Evaluate Distribution of Expected Study Variables
title: Evaluate Distribution of Expected Study Variables
text: Expected Variables Present module checks presence provides distributions variables dataset. allows investigator visualize multiple variables comparison show co-occurrence variables patient.

title: Evaluate Distribution of Expected Study Variables
text: can install development version package like :
code: devtools::install_github('ssdqa/expectedvariablespresent')

title: Compute variable distribution (OMOP) — compute_evp_omop
text: Compute variable distribution (OMOP)

title: Compute variable distribution (OMOP) — compute_evp_omop
code: compute_evp_omop(   cohort,   grouped_list,   time = FALSE,   evp_variable_file = expectedvariablespresent::evp_variable_file_omop )

title: Compute variable distribution (OMOP) — compute_evp_omop
text: cohort table cohort members least site, person_id, start_date, end_date grouped_list list columns used group table time logical determine whether function run part compute_fot evp_variable_file CSV file information variables examined function. contains following columns: variable label variable captured associated codeset default_tbl CDM table data related codeset found concept_field concept_id field codes associated codeset date_field date field default_tbl used time analyses codeset_name name codeset file; include file extension filter_logic string indicating filter logic applied achieve desired variable; optional

title: Compute variable distribution (OMOP) — compute_evp_omop
text: dataframe patient/row counts proportions computed per group defined grouped_list, time = TRUE, time period defined compute_fot

title: Compute variable distribution (PCORnet) — compute_evp_pcnt
text: Compute variable distribution (PCORnet)

title: Compute variable distribution (PCORnet) — compute_evp_pcnt
code: compute_evp_pcnt(   cohort,   grouped_list,   time = FALSE,   evp_variable_file = expectedvariablespresent::evp_variable_file_pcornet )

title: Compute variable distribution (PCORnet) — compute_evp_pcnt
text: cohort table cohort members least site, person_id, start_date, end_date grouped_list list columns used group table time logical determine whether function run part compute_fot evp_variable_file CSV file information variables examined function. contains following columns: variable label variable captured associated codeset default_tbl CDM table data related codeset found concept_field concept_id field codes associated codeset date_field date field default_tbl used time analyses vocabulary_field PCORNET ; field default_tbl defines vocabulary type concept (.e. dx_type) field used, codeset vocabulary_id column defines appropriate vocabularies concept codeset_name name codeset file; include file extension filter_logic string indicating filter logic applied achieve desired variable; optional

title: Compute variable distribution (PCORnet) — compute_evp_pcnt
text: dataframe patient/row counts proportions computed per group defined grouped_list, time = TRUE, time period defined compute_fot

title: Multi Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional*  — evp_ms_anom_cs
code: evp_ms_anom_cs(   process_output,   output_level,   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL,   text_wrapping_char = 60 )

title: Multi Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional*  — evp_ms_anom_cs
text: process_output output provided evp_process function output_level level output displayed: patient row large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally generate filtered visualization text_wrapping_char integer value indicating point axis label text begin wrap

title: Multi Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional*  — evp_ms_anom_cs
text: dot plot shape dot represents whether point anomalous, color dot represents proportion rows/patients given variable, size dot represents mean proportion across sites
code: if there were no groups eligible for analysis, a heat map showing the proportion     and a dot plot showing each site's average standard deviation away from the mean     proportion is returned instead

title: Multi-Site, Anomaly, Longitudinal — evp_ms_anom_la
text: process_output output evp_process output_level level output shown (person row) filter_variable variable used generate output large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally generate filtered visualization

title: Multi-Site, Anomaly, Longitudinal — evp_ms_anom_la
text: three graphs: line graph shows smoothed proportion variable across time computation Euclidean distance associated line line graph shows raw proportion variable across time computation Euclidean distance associated line bar graph Euclidean distance value site, average proportion fill GRAPH SHOWS ONE VARIABLE TIME!

what: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
title: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
text: Using tabular output generated evp_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
code: evp_output(   process_output,   output_level = "patient",   filter_variable = NULL,   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced evp_process output_level string || defaults patient string indicating analysis level reflected plot. checks utilize parameter EXCEPT Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional, executes Jaccard index using patient counts filter_variable string vector || defaults NULL string vector variable names focus analysis. single value accepted following checks: Multi Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal (non-year time period) Multi Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Multiple values (3) accepted : Multi Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal (year time period) large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information.

title: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
text: function produce graph visualize results evp_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Expected Variables Present – Output Generation — evp_output
code:
#' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'expectedvariablespresent')) #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop() #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'evp_process_test', working_directory = my_directory, db_conn = conn, is_json = FALSE, file_subdirectory = my_file_folder, cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()` #' Build mock study cohort cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), # RSQLite does not store date objects, # hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Execute `evp_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration evp_process_example <- evp_process(cohort = cohort, multi_or_single_site = 'single', anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory', time = FALSE, omop_or_pcornet = 'omop', evp_variable_file = evp_variable_file_omop) %>% suppressMessages() #> ┌ Output Function Details ──────────────────────────────────────┐ #> │ You can optionally use this dataframe in the accompanying │ #> │ `evp_output` function. Here are the parameters you will need: │ #> │ │ #> │ Always Required: process_output │ #> │ Required for Check: output_level │ #> │ │ #> │ See ?evp_output for more details. │ #> └───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ evp_process_example #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #> site total_pt_ct total_row_ct variable_pt_ct variable_row_ct prop_pt_variable #> #> 1 comb… 7 70 5 5 0.714 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: prop_row_variable , variable , #> # output_function #' Execute `evp_output` function evp_output_example <- evp_output(process_output = evp_process_example, output_level = 'patient') evp_output_example #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()` make_interactive_squba(evp_output_example) {"x":{"data":[{"orientation":"v","width":0.71399999999999997,"base":0.55000000000000004,"x":[0.35699999999999998],"y":[0.89999999999999991],"text":"prop_pt_variable: 0.714
variable: Sample OMOP Variable

title: Expected Variables Present — evp_process
text: completeness module assess presence expected study variables compute distribution variables dataset. user provide variables (evp_variable_file) interest, including name concept sets concepts used define variable. Sample versions inputs, OMOP PCORnet, included data package accessible expectedvariablespresent::. Results can optionally stratified site, age group, /time. function compatible OMOP PCORnet CDMs based user's selection.

title: Expected Variables Present — evp_process
code: evp_process(   cohort,   omop_or_pcornet,   evp_variable_file,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   output_level = "patient",   age_groups = NULL,   p_value = 0.9,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Expected Variables Present — evp_process
text: cohort tabular input || required cohort used data quality testing. table contain, minimum: site | character | name(s) institutions included cohort person_id / patid | integer / character | patient identifier start_date | date | start cohort period end_date | date | end cohort period Note start end dates included table used limit search window analyses module. omop_or_pcornet string || required string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data omop: run evp_process_omop() function OMOP CDM instance pcornet: run evp_process_pcornet() function PCORnet CDM instance evp_variable_file tabular input || required table information variables examined analysis. table contain following columns: variable | character | string label variable captured associated codeset domain_tbl | character | CDM table variable found concept_field | character | string name field domain table concepts located date_field | character | name field domain table date used temporal filtering vocabulary_field | character | PCORnet applications, name field domain table vocabulary identifier differentiate concepts one another (ex: dx_type); can set NA OMOP applications codeset_name | character | name codeset defines variable interest filter_logic | character | logic applied domain_tbl order achieve definition interest; written applying dplyr::filter command R see example structure file, please see ?expectedvariablespresent::evp_variable_file_omop ?expectedvariablespresent::evp_variable_file_pcornet multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string || defaults exploratory string, either anomaly exploratory, indicating type results produced. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. output_level string || defaults patient string indicating analysis level use basis Multi Site, Anomaly Detection computations Acceptable values either patient row age_groups tabular input || defaults NULL like stratify results age group, create table CSV file following columns use input parameter: min_age | integer | minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age | integer | maximum age group (.e. 20) group | character | string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave NULL p_value numeric || defaults 0.9 p value used threshold Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis time boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicate whether execute longitudinal analysis time_span vector - length 2 || defaults c('2012-01-01', '2020-01-01') vector indicating lower upper bounds time series longitudinal analyses time_period string || defaults year string indicating distance dates within specified time_span. Defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Expected Variables Present — evp_process
text: function return dataframe summarizing distribution user-defined variable. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Expected Variables Present — evp_process
code:
#' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'expectedvariablespresent')) #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop() #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'evp_process_test', working_directory = my_directory, db_conn = conn, is_json = FALSE, file_subdirectory = my_file_folder, cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()` #' Build mock study cohort cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), # RSQLite does not store date objects, # hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Execute `evp_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration evp_process_example <- evp_process(cohort = cohort, multi_or_single_site = 'single', anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory', time = FALSE, omop_or_pcornet = 'omop', evp_variable_file = evp_variable_file_omop) %>% suppressMessages() #> ┌ Output Function Details ──────────────────────────────────────┐ #> │ You can optionally use this dataframe in the accompanying │ #> │ `evp_output` function. Here are the parameters you will need: │ #> │ │ #> │ Always Required: process_output │ #> │ Required for Check: output_level │ #> │ │ #> │ See ?evp_output for more details. │ #> └───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ evp_process_example #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #> site total_pt_ct total_row_ct variable_pt_ct variable_row_ct prop_pt_variable #> #> 1 comb… 7 70 5 5 0.714 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: prop_row_variable , variable , #> # output_function #' Execute `evp_output` function evp_output_example <- evp_output(process_output = evp_process_example, output_level = 'patient') evp_output_example #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()` make_interactive_squba(evp_output_example) {"x":{"data":[{"orientation":"v","width":0.71399999999999997,"base":0.55000000000000004,"x":[0.35699999999999998],"y":[0.89999999999999991],"text":"prop_pt_variable: 0.714

title: Expected Variables Present – OMOP — evp_process_omop
text: Expected Variables Present – OMOP

title: Expected Variables Present – OMOP — evp_process_omop
code: evp_process_omop(   cohort,   evp_variable_file = expectedvariablespresent::evp_variable_file_omop,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   output_level = "row",   age_groups = NULL,   p_value = 0.9,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Expected Variables Present – OMOP — evp_process_omop
text: cohort dataframe cohort patients study. include columns: person_id start_date end_date site evp_variable_file CSV file information variables examined function. contains following columns: variable label variable captured associated codeset default_tbl CDM table data related codeset found concept_field concept_id field codes associated codeset date_field date field default_tbl used time analyses codeset_name name codeset file; include file extension filter_logic string indicating filter logic applied achieve desired variable; optional multi_or_single_site Option run function single vs multiple sites single: run function single site multi: run function multiple sites anomaly_or_exploratory Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. output_level level output use AUC computation, exclusive ms_anom_at; either patient row – defaults row age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis time logical tells function whether like look output time time_span time = TRUE, argument defines start end dates time period interest. formatted c(start date, end date) yyyy-mm-dd date format time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Expected Variables Present – OMOP — evp_process_omop
text: dataframe patient/row counts & proportions concept set listed evp_concept_file. output used evp_output function generate appropriate visualization

title: Expected Variables Present – PCORnet — evp_process_pcornet
text: cohort dataframe cohort patients study. include columns: person_id start_date end_date site evp_variable_file CSV file information variables examined function. contains following columns: variable label variable captured associated codeset default_tbl CDM table data related codeset found concept_field concept_id field codes associated codeset date_field date field default_tbl used time analyses vocabulary_field PCORNET ; field default_tbl defines vocabulary type concept (.e. dx_type) field used, codeset vocabulary_id column defines appropriate vocabularies concept codeset_name name codeset file; include file extension filter_logic string indicating filter logic applied achieve desired variable; optional multi_or_single_site Option run function single vs multiple sites single: run function single site multi: run function multiple sites anomaly_or_exploratory Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. output_level level output use AUC computation, exclusive ms_anom_at; either patient row – defaults row age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis time logical tells function whether like look output time time_span time = TRUE, argument defines start end dates time period interest. formatted c(start date, end date) yyyy-mm-dd date format time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

code: if analysis was executed by month or smaller, an STL regression is     conducted and outliers are marked with red dots. the graphs representing     the data removed in the regression are also returned
